newsitem.title: USA: Internet service providers shares up on Digix deal.
newsitem.headline: Internet service providers shares up on Digix deal.

text.p: Shares of Internet service providers were up after Intermedia Communications said Thursday it would buy DIGEX Inc for about $150 million, fueling speculation of more industry consolidation.
Shares of DIGEX, an Internet access provider and Web hosting service in Washington, were up 1-7/8 to 12-3/4.

Analysts said shares of Internet access providers that are likely merger targets were benefitting from speculation on further industry consolidation. PSINet Inc rose 1-1/4 to 9-1/8 and Netcom Online Communications Inc tacked on 1-3/8 to 15-1/8.

"It's like a wave that is getting bigger," said Frank Dzubeck, president of Communications Network Architects in Washington. "There are 4,000 ISPs (Internet service providers) in the world. By the year 2000, we predict there will be only 400." Last month, GTE Corp said it would buy BBN Corp for about $616 million in one of the biggest deals for an Internet service provider. BBN also has network security, consulting and systems integration services. It was one of the pioneers developing the first incarnation of the Internet.
Dzubeck said a startup called Verio in Englewood, Colo., has invested in or acquired 19 ISPs with plans to buy more.
